intro: Bunchosia petenensis, commonly known as the Petén bunchosia, is a shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woody growth habit. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Bunchosia petenensis is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical environments, often found in dry or semi-arid regions.
